Military.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with fair integrity is largely intact with some changes in primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.

Threats.meaning: Moderate threats indicates that incremental changes in land use on or close to the battle site are occuring and smaller core parcels are threatened. Some loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Military.meaning: Decisive: A general engagement involving field armies in which a commander achieved a vital strategic objective. Such a result might include an indisputable victory on the field or be limited to the success or termination of a campaign offensive.  Decisive battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the war.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with fair integrity is largely intact with some changes in primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.

Threats.meaning: Moderate threats indicates that incremental changes in land use on or close to the battle site are occuring and smaller core parcels are threatened. Some loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Theater Code.meaning: Main Western Theater of Operations & the Gulf Approach (1861-1863)

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Decisive battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the war.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Ed.meaning: Decisive: A general engagement involving field armies in which a commander achieved a vital strategic objective. Such a result might include an indisputable victory on the field or be limited to the success or termination of a campaign offensive.  Decisive battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the war.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Threats.meaning: Moderate threats indicates that incremental changes in land use on or close to the battle site are occuring and smaller core parcels are threatened. Some loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Theater Code.meaning: Main Western Theater of Operations & the Gulf Approach (1861-1863)

Ed.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Threats.meaning: Moderate threats indicates that incremental changes in land use on or close to the battle site are occuring and smaller core parcels are threatened. Some loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Ed.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A local site has changed beyond recognition, meaning that a local resident of the time returning to the site today presumably would not recognize his surroundings. Lost battlefields may retain small (1-50 acres) parcels suitable for commemoration, however, the ability to interpret the battle on the landscape has been lost.

Threats.meaning: Threat level is Not Applicable because the battle site landscape is deemed lost.

Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with fair integrity is largely intact with some changes in primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Limited: An engagement, typically involving detachments of the field armies, in which a commander achived a limited tactical objective of reconnaissance, defense, or occupation.  Limited battles maintained contact between the combatants without observable influence on the direction of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A local site has changed beyond recognition, meaning that a local resident of the time returning to the site today presumably would not recognize his surroundings. Lost battlefields may retain small (1-50 acres) parcels suitable for commemoration, however, the ability to interpret the battle on the landscape has been lost.

Threats.meaning: Threat level is Not Applicable because the battle site landscape is deemed lost.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with poor integrity is significantly altered in terms of its primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings. Integrity.meaning: A local site has changed beyond recognition, meaning that a local resident of the time returning to the site today presumably would not recognize his surroundings. Lost battlefields may retain small (1-50 acres) parcels suitable for commemoration, however, the ability to interpret the battle on the landscape has been lost.

Threats.meaning: Threat level is Not Applicable because the battle site landscape is deemed lost.

Military.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Jim.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Threats.meaning: High threats means that there is rapidly changing land use on or close to the battle site and large core parcels are threatened. Substantial loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Theater Code.meaning: Main Western Theater of Operations & the Gulf Approach (1861-1863)

Military.meaning: Decisive: A general engagement involving field armies in which a commander achieved a vital strategic objective. Such a result might include an indisputable victory on the field or be limited to the success or termination of a campaign offensive.  Decisive battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the war.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with fair integrity is largely intact with some changes in primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.

Threats.meaning: Moderate threats indicates that incremental changes in land use on or close to the battle site are occuring and smaller core parcels are threatened. Some loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Threats.meaning: Threat level is Not Applicable because the battle site landscape is deemed lost.

Bill.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with poor integrity is significantly altered in terms of its primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.  Road construction and changes in land use are usually evident at sites with poor integrity.  Sites with poor integrity sometimes retain core parcels (50-200 acres) intact within the generally fragmented landscape.

Threats.meaning: High threats means that there is rapidly changing land use on or close to the battle site and large core parcels are threatened. Substantial loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Campaign Code.meaning: Efforts to Establish Posts in Texas (1862-63), 09/01/62, II

Ed.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Limited: An engagement, typically involving detachments of the field armies, in which a commander achived a limited tactical objective of reconnaissance, defense, or occupation.  Limited battles maintained contact between the combatants without observable influence on the direction of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A local site has changed beyond recognition, meaning that a local resident of the time returning to the site today presumably would not recognize his surroundings. Lost battlefields may retain small (1-50 acres) parcels suitable for commemoration, however, the ability to interpret the battle on the landscape has been lost.

Sites with poor integrity sometimes retain core parcels (50-200 acres) intact within the generally fragmented landscape.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Ed.meaning: Limited: An engagement, typically involving detachments of the field armies, in which a commander achived a limited tactical objective of reconnaissance, defense, or occupation.  Limited battles maintained contact between the combatants without observable influence on the direction of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Formative: An engagement involving divisions or detachments of the field armies in which a commader accomplished a limited campaign objective of reconnaissance, disruption, defense, or occupation.  Formative battles had an observable influence on the direction, duration, or conduct of the campaign.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Military.meaning: Decisive: A general engagement involving field armies in which a commander achieved a vital strategic objective. Such a result might include an indisputable victory on the field or be limited to the success or termination of a campaign offensive.  Decisive battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the war.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with good integrity is essentially unchanged from the historic period with respect to terrain, land use, road network, and mass and scale of buildings.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with fair integrity is largely intact with some changes in primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Ed.meaning: Limited: An engagement, typically involving detachments of the field armies, in which a commander achived a limited tactical objective of reconnaissance, defense, or occupation. Military.meaning: Limited: An engagement, typically involving detachments of the field armies, in which a commander achived a limited tactical objective of reconnaissance, defense, or occupation.  Limited battles maintained contact between the combatants without observable influence on the direction of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with poor integrity is significantly altered in terms of its primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.  Road construction and changes in land use are usually evident at sites with poor integrity.  Sites with poor integrity sometimes retain core parcels (50-200 acres) intact within the generally fragmented landscape.

Threats.meaning: High threats means that there is rapidly changing land use on or close to the battle site and large core parcels are threatened. Substantial loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Ed.meaning: Decisive: A general engagement involving field armies in which a commander achieved a vital strategic objective. Such a result might include an indisputable victory on the field or be limited to the success or termination of a campaign offensive.  Decisive battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the war.

Military.meaning: Limited: An engagement, typically involving detachments of the field armies, in which a commander achived a limited tactical objective of reconnaissance, defense, or occupation.  Limited battles maintained contact between the combatants without observable influence on the direction of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A local site has changed beyond recognition, meaning that a local resident of the time returning to the site today presumably would not recognize his surroundings. Lost battlefields may retain small (1-50 acres) parcels suitable for commemoration, however, the ability to interpret the battle on the landscape has been lost.

Threats.meaning: Threat level is Not Applicable because the battle site landscape is deemed lost.

Military.meaning: Major: An engagement of magnitude involving field armies or divisions of the armies in which a commander achived an important strategic objective within the context of an ongoing campaign offensive.  Major battles had a direct, observable impact on the direction, duration, conduct, or outcome of the campaign.

Integrity.meaning: A battle site with fair integrity is largely intact with some changes in primary geographical and topographical configuration and mass and scale of the buildings.

Threats.meaning: Moderate threats indicates that incremental changes in land use on or close to the battle site are occuring and smaller core parcels are threatened. Some loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.

Threats.meaning: Low threats means that land use on and close to the battle site are changing slowly and core parcels do not appear to be threatened. Minimal loss of battle site landscape is expected within ten years.
